channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘I’m at a loss’: My boyfriend of nearly 10 years is naming his elderly parents as his powers of attorney and his beneficiaries. Am I right to be upset?
item.description: “I own the house we live in and he pays me a small amount of rent every month to help cover my mortgage and utilities.”

item.title: Nvidia's Coming Year Will Be a Turbulent One
item.description: The AI titan will maintain its strong lead, but complicated product rollouts, sky-high expectations and the China threat add complications to growth p...

item.title: I’m a 73-year-old widower who wants to take 6% out of my 401(k) instead of 4%. Can I afford it?
item.description: “I will receive $105,000 per year in retirement. I earn $135,000 a year now.”

item.title: Europe's Gas Price at Highest Levels as Geopolitical Risks Threaten Supplies
item.description: European natural-gas prices were at their highest level of the year, boosted by growing geopolitical risks and higher demand, with market concerns dri...

item.title: South African Rand Falls as Rate Cut Expected
item.description: The rand fell ahead of the South African Reserve Bank’s policy decision later as most economists expect the central bank will cut interest rates by 25...

item.title: Beware of the ‘Ponzi funds’ that are hiding in plain sight, says strategist
item.description: The rise of thematic funds leads to Ponzi-like situations, say researchers.

item.title: ‘I can’t deal with managing them’: I juggle 18 credit cards. How do I close them without ruining my credit score?
item.description: “I have very high limits, so charges barely make a blip on my credit-utilization ratio.”

item.title: MicroStrategy's Magical Bitcoin Buying Machine Uses Some Wacky Math
item.description: Citing “yield” as a performance measure is likely to confuse some investors already overpaying for its stock.

item.title: The Trump Stock Euphoria Starts to Fade
item.description: Tariffs, deficits and stretched valuations give Wall Street pause.

item.title: ‘God works in mysterious ways’: I became a Nvidia millionaire playing ‘World of Warcraft.’ Am I smart — or just lucky?
item.description: “I had no job and no unemployment benefits.”
